description.narrative: Develop the national Mine Action infrastructure and national capacity and as the national capacity is developed provide direct support to a co-ordinated Mine Action Sector to include downstream counter-IED.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative:
Output 1: National Mine Action Authorities have improved capacities to carry-out mine activities that are consistent with priorities.
1.1. Number of staff completing training on coordination. 1.2. Percentage of trained staff that were rated as more effective in doing their job one year later , through a KAP survey 1.3. Extent to which YMACC technical capacity coordinate and support the implementation of emergency preparedness plans in changing context that meet priorities and national standards through percentage of tasking orders issued, QM visits conducted, and Handover / Completion certifcates certified. 1.4. A Results-Based Management system to track activities in place
Output 2: ERW clearance and land release interventions are delivered in contaminated communities
2.1 Percentage of operators who benefitted from regular technical training 2.2 Percentage of task orders carried out to NMAS as verified by the YMACC and confirmed by UNDP 2.3. Percentage of population in UXO-contaminated communities who perceive that UXO interventions have supported improvements in safety and better lives 2.4 Percentage of women who feel that their life saving and livelihoods conditions improved through YEMAC interventions 2.5. Percentage of positive 'satisfaction surveys’ completed by Third Party Monitoring [TPM].
Output 3: The Yemen Mine Action Authorities have capacity to effectively coordinate, regulate and plan the mapping of ERW contamination and assessing the impact using primary and secondary sources and fulfill international treaty obligations
3.1 Stretegic plan completed along with associated policies 3.2 Progression of minimum of one+ step in 4 categories as outlined in the mine action and CIED Maturity Model 3.3 Number of explosive threats to shipping recorded and potentially mapped to identify areas of safe passage 3.4 Number of entries on the IMSMA database
"Output 4: The communities at risk have increased their knowledge on identifying, dealing and

comment.narrative:
Output 1: National Mine Action Authorities lack sufficient capacities to carry-out mine activities that are consistent with changing priorities and types of contamination.
Output 2: ERW clearance and land release interventions are falling far short of the needed levels given the high degree of contamination which is also new and for which counterparts are not trained to deal with.
Output 3: The capacity of the Yemen Mine Action Authorities to effectively coordinate, regulate and plan the mapping of ERW contamination is basic at best and needs constant professional support. a
Output 4: The communities at risk lack knowledge on identifying, dealing and avoiding mines and unexploded ordnance
The project is still in its preparation stage
The project is still in its preparation stage
